intro: Erucastrum decandollii, commonly known as the mountain mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold climates. Erucastrum decandollii is often found in alpine meadows and has a limited distribution due to its specific ecological requirements.
